cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSW of Charleston South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then curving north-northeast along the southeast U.S. coast toward South Carolina and southern North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina, near the Charleston area

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Fernandina Beach FL to Surf City NC (includes the entire South Carolina coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through Georgia and South Carolina into southern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds with gusts over 74 mph expected during Saturday morning as the eye passes near the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of 5–7 ft above ground possible in the Charleston Harbor and adjacent waterways.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with locally higher totals up to 15 inches may cause flash flooding in the Charleston metro area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents, and an isolated tornado threat near the coast.
